===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|おう}}
{{IPAchar|/apu/}} → {{IPAchar|/afu/}} → {{IPAchar|/au/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/oː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|凹|tr={{IPAchar|/ʔˠɛp̚/}}}}.  Compare modern {{cog|cmn|-}} reading ''āo'', {{cog|nan|-}} ''au''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|おう}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|おう|hhira=あふ}}

# {{l|en|concave}}

=====Usage notes=====
The character {{lang|ja|凹}} with the reading ''ō'' is only used in compounds, and never in isolation.

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds using {{lang|ja|凹}} (''ō'')}}
* {{ja-l|凹角|おうかく|ōkaku}}: a [[reflex]] [[angle]]
* {{ja-l|凹型|おうがた|ōgata}}: a [[die]] or other [[three-dimensional]] [[shape]] having a [[concave]] [[cross-section]]
* {{ja-l|凹形|おうけい|ōkei}}: a [[concave]] [[shape]]
* {{ja-l|凹状|おうじょう|ōjō}}: [[concavity]]
* {{ja-l|凹多角形|おうたかくけい|ō takakukei}}: a [[polygon]] with at least one [[internal]] [[reflex]] [[angle]]
* {{ja-l|凹地|おうち|ōchi}}: an area where the [[ground]] is noticeable [[lower]] than the surrounding area
* {{ja-l|凹凸|おうとつ|ōtotsu}}: [[bumpiness]], [[unevenness]]; [[inequality]], [[variation]], [[ups and downs]]
* {{ja-l|凹凸画|おうとつが|ōtotsu ga}}: a style of [[w:Sui Dynasty|Sui-Dynasty]] [[wall]] [[painting]] using [[trompe l'oeil]] techniques to look three-dimensional
* {{ja-l|凹凸レンズ|おうとつれんず|ōtotsu renzu}}: a [[concavo]]-[[convex]] [[lens]]
* {{ja-l|凹版|おうはん|ōhan}}: an [[intaglio]]
* {{ja-l|凹版印刷|おうはんいんさつ|ōhan insatsu}}: [[intaglio]] [[printing]]
* {{ja-l|凹面|おうめん|ōmen}}: a [[concave]] [[surface]]
* {{ja-l|凹面鏡|おうめんきょう|ōmenkyō}}: a [[concave]] [[mirror]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|準凹|じゅんおう|jun'ō}}: [[quasiconcavity]]
* {{ja-l|凸凹|とつおう|totsuō}}: [[bumpiness]], [[unevenness]]; [[inequality]], [[variation]], [[ups and downs]]
* {{ja-l|凸凹瘢痕|とつおうはんこん|totsuō hankon}}: an [[uneven]] [[scar]]
* {{ja-l|凸凹レンズ|とつおうれんず|totsuō renzu}}: a [[convexo]]-[[concave]] [[lens]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くぼ}}
{{unk.|lang=ja|sort=くぼ}}. Sound similarities might suggest a connection to words related to {{m|en|darkness}} or ''deep'' {{m|en|interior}}, such as {{m|ja|雲|tr=kumo||cloud}}, {{m|ja|蜘蛛|tr=kumo||spider}}, {{m|ja|隈|tr=kuma||a recess, a deep interior corner}}, {{m|ja|黒|tr=kuro||black}}, {{m|ja|暗|tr=kura||darkness}}; more at {{ja-l|黒}}. Alternately, these broad similarities might be pure coincidence.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くぼ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|窪}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くぼ}}

# an area with sides higher than the center: an {{l|en|indentation}}, a {{l|en|depression}}, a {{l|en|dip}}, a {{l|en|divot}}, a {{l|en|hole}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=くぼ|slang}} female {{l|en|genitalia}}, the {{l|en|vagina}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top|Terms derived from {{lang|ja|凹}} (''kubo'')}}
* {{ja-l|窪い}}, {{ja-l|凹い|くぼい|kuboi}}: [[hollowed]] [[out]], [[indented]]; of [[low]] [[status]], [[mean]]
* {{ja-l|窪か}}, {{ja-l|凹か|くぼか|kuboka}}: [[hollowed]] [[out]], [[indented]], [[depressed]] (physically), [[low]]
* {{ja-l|窪む}}, {{ja-l|凹む|くぼむ|kubomu}}: to become [[hollowed]] [[out]] or [[indented]]; to [[hollow]] [[out]] or [[indent]] something; to [[sink]] [[inwardly]], to [[collapse]] inwardly; to [[fall]] upon [[hard time]]s, to become [[poor]]
* {{ja-l|窪み}}, {{ja-l|窪}}, {{ja-l|凹み}}, {{ja-l|凹|くぼみ|kubomi}}: ''see below''
* {{ja-l|窪まる}}, {{ja-l|凹まる|くぼまる|kubomaru}}: to become [[hollowed]] [[out]] or [[indented]]; to [[squat]] for a while, to [[sink]] into a [[crouch]]
* {{ja-l|窪める}}, {{ja-l|凹める|くぼめる|kubomeru}}: to [[make]] something [[sink]] or [[collapse]] [[inwardly]]; to [[dent]] something; to make something into a [[hollowed]] [[out]] shape
* {{ja-l|窪やか}}, {{ja-l|凹やか|くぼやか|kuboyaka}}: [[hollowed]] [[out]], [[indented]], [[depressed]] (physically), [[low]]
* {{ja-l|窪窪}}, {{ja-l|凹凹|くぼくぼ|kubokubo}}: in a [[hollowed]] [[out]] or [[indented]] way
* {{ja-l|窪地}}, {{ja-l|凹地|くぼち|kubochi}}: a [[hollow]], a [[dip]], a [[depression]] or [[low]] spot in the [[ground]]
* {{ja-l|窪田}}, {{ja-l|凹田|くぼた|kubota}}: a [[paddy]] or [[wet]] [[field]] in a [[low]] [[place]]
* {{ja-l|窪目}}, {{ja-l|窪眼}}, {{ja-l|凹目}}, {{ja-l|凹眼|くぼめ|kubome}}: [[deep-set]] [[eye]]s, [[sunken]] eyes
* {{ja-l|窪溜}}, {{ja-l|凹溜|くぼたまり|kubotamari}}: a [[low]] [[place]] where water tends to gather
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|笑窪}}, {{ja-l|靨|えくぼ|ekubo}}: a [[dimple]], particularly one from [[smiling]]
* {{ja-l|大窪}}, {{ja-l|大久保|おおくぼ|Ōkubo}}: a [[surname]]
* {{ja-l|落窪}}, {{ja-l|落ち窪|おちくぼ|ochikubo}}: a [[dip]] in the [[floor]] or [[ground]]
* {{ja-l|手窪}}, {{ja-l|手凹|てくぼ|tekubo}}: ''see ''te no kubo'' just below''
* {{ja-l|手の窪}}, {{ja-l|手の凹|てのくぼ|te no kubo}}: a [[cupped]] [[hand]]; a [[rice]] [[ball]]; [[eat]]ing [[rice]] by [[hand]]; a [[one-night stand]], a [[fling]] or [[short-term]] [[romance]]
* {{ja-l|中窪}}, {{ja-l|凹|なかくぼ|nakakubo}}: ''see below''
* {{ja-l|盆の窪|ぼんのくぼ|bon no kubo}}: the [[hollow]] of the [[nape]] of the [[neck]]; a [[hairstyle]] for [[infant]]s in the [[w:Edo_period|Edo period]], [[shave|shaving]] the whole head except for a small area on the [[nape]] of the [[neck]]
* {{ja-l|目窪}}, {{ja-l|目凹|めくぼ|mekubo}}: [[sunken]] [[eye]]s; a person with sunken or [[deep-set]] eyes
{{der-bottom}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|indentation}} {{ja-l|窪み}}, {{ja-l|窪}}, {{ja-l|凹み}}, {{ja-l|凹|くぼみ|kubomi}} (''see below'')
* {{sense|female genitalia}} {{ja-l|前門|ぜんもん|zenmon}}, {{ja-l|まんこ||manko}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くぼみ}}
Noun stem of verb {{m|ja|凹む|tr=kubomu||to become hollow, to become sunken, to become indented}}, itself a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=くぼみ|凹|tr1=kubo|t1=an indentation, a dip|む|tr2=mu|t2=to become like something|pos2=auxiliary verb attaching to nouns or adjective stems, cognate with {{ja-l|びる}} ''biru''}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くぼみ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|窪み}}, {{ja-l|窪}}, {{ja-l|凹み}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くぼみ}}

# a {{l|en|pit}}, a {{l|en|hollow}}, a {{l|en|cavity}}, a {{l|en|depression}}, a {{l|en|dent}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top|Terms derived from {{lang|ja|凹}} (''kubomi'')}}
* {{ja-l|凹石}}, {{ja-l|窪石|くぼみいし|kubomi ishi}}: an [[artifact]] from the [[w:Jōmon_period|Jōmon period]], consisting of a flat stone with one to several indentations, of uncertain utility but thought to be used to help start fires
{{der-bottom}}

=====Usage notes=====
The {{ja-l|凹み}} or {{ja-l|窪み}} spelling with the {{l|ja|sc=Latn|送り仮名|okurigana}} {{lang|ja|み}} is more common when used as a standalone term. The spelling without the okurigana is more common in compounds.

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|なかくぼ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なかくぼ|中|tr1=naka|t1=inside, inner|窪|tr2=kubo|t2=pit, indentation}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|なかくぼ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=2|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|中窪}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|なかくぼ}}

# a {{l|en|sunken}} {{l|en|center}}
# a {{l|en|place}} or {{l|en|object}} with a sunken center

=====Usage notes=====
The {{ja-l|中窪}} spelling is more common.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-l|中低|なかびく|nakabiku}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|へこみ}}
Noun stem of verb {{m|ja|凹む|tr=hekomu||to become hollow, to become sunken, to become indented}}, itself an [[abbreviate]]d compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=へこみ|減る|alt1=減り|tr1=heri|pos1=noun stem of verb {{ja-l|減る}} ''heru'', “to reduce, to decrease, to diminish”|込む|tr2=komu|t2=to go inwardly}}.<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|へこみ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|凹み}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|へこみ}}

# a {{l|en|pit}}, a {{l|en|hollow}}, a {{l|en|cavity}}, a {{l|en|depression}}, a {{l|en|dent}}
# a {{l|en|mistake}}, and {{l|en|error}}
# a {{l|en|moment}} of {{l|en|weakness}} or {{l|en|confusion}}, being {{l|en|at a loss}}

=====Usage notes=====
The {{ja-l|凹み}} spelling is more common.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|hollow}} {{ja-l|窪み}}, {{ja-l|窪}}, {{ja-l|凹み}}, {{ja-l|凹|くぼみ|kubomi}} (''also see above'')
* {{sense|mistake}} {{ja-l|失策|しっさく|shissaku}}
* {{sense|mistake}} {{ja-l|失敗|しっぱい|shippai}}
* {{sense|at a loss}} {{ja-l|困惑|こんわく|konwaku}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ぼこ}}
Uncertain. Possibly [[onomatopoeic]] from the sound of a wheel bouncing in a rut or pothole, or from the sound of something hollow when tapped. Compare adverb {{m|ja|ぼこぼこ|tr=bokoboko||full of holes; hollowly}}.

Alternately, may be compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほこ'|ぼ|tr1=bo|t1=empty?|pos1=uncertain; possibly related to verb {{ja-l|掘る}} ''horu'', “to dig, to dig out”|こ|tr2=ko|t2=place|pos2=suffixing element seen in other words such as {{ja-l|そこ}} ''soko'', “there” or {{ja-l|端っこ}} ''hashikko'', “edge, end, tip”}}. Compare {{m|ja|凸|tr=deko||protrusion}}, likely a compound of {{m|ja|出|tr=de||coming out}} + {{m|ja|こ|tr=ko||place|pos=suffixing element}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ぼこ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぼこ}}

# an {{l|en|indentation}}, a {{l|en|dip}} or {{l|en|divot}}, a {{l|en|hollow}}, a {{l|en|dent}} in a surface

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top|Terms derived from {{lang|ja|凹}} (''boko'')}}
* {{ja-l|ぼこぼこ||bokoboko}}: [[unevenly]], [[bumpily]], [[pitted]], [[dented]] (in multiple places), [[full]] of [[hole]]s; [[hollowly]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|穴ぼこ|あなぼこ|anaboko}}: a [[hole]], a [[rut]], a [[pothole]]
* {{ja-l|凸凹|でこぼこ|dekoboko}}: [[unevenness]], [[bumpiness]], [[jaggedness]]; [[inequality]], [[disparity]]
{{der-bottom}}
